name: 施岳廷
objective: This course aims to teach students the fundamental knowledge of ceramic materials used for thermal and/or mechanical application. It will start with a quick review of ceramic materials and ceramic processing. Afterward, important concepts of the thermal and mechanical properties of ceramics will be discussed.
schedule:
W1 Introduction
W2 Review of ceramic materials
W3 Review of ceramic processing
W4 Heat capacity
W5 Sports day, no class
W6 Thermal conductivity
W7 Spring break, no class
W8 Thermal expansion
W9 Elastic properties
W10 Elastic properties
W11 Elastic properties
W12 Strength and brittle fracture
W13 Strength and brittle fracture
W14 Strength and brittle fracture
W15 Toughing
W16 Fatigue and creep
W17 Thermal stress and thermal shock
W18 Final exam
materials:
Reference: 
1.　　W. D. Kingery, H. K. Bowen and D. R. Uhlmann, Introduction to Ceramics. (Wiley, 1976).
2.　　J. B. Wachtman, W. R. Cannon and M. J. Matthewson, Mechanical Properties of Ceramics. (Wiley, 2009).
3.　　Y. M. Chiang, D. P. Birnie and W. D. Kingery, Physical Ceramics: Principles for Ceramic Science and Engineering. (Wiley, 1996).
4.　　J. S. Reed, Principles of Ceramics Processing. (Wiley, 1995).
